title: Projectile motion - launching at different angles

content.question: Two identical balls, Ball <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Ball <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are hit from the same initial position and move along the trajectories shown in the figure. The initial speed of Ball <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is less than that of Ball <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which ball takes less time to return to the ground, and what evidence supports this claim?

choices.label: Ball <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> takes less time. Its initial speed is less than that of Ball <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

Ball <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> takes less time. The horizontal distance it travels is less than that of Ball <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

Ball <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> takes less time. Its initial speed is greater than that of Ball <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

Ball <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> takes less time. The maximum height it reaches is less than that of Ball <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: Ball <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> takes less time. The maximum height it reaches is less than that of Ball <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

topic.text: 1.5: Motion in Two or Three Dimensions

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
